natural problem:
Given $\|\mathbf{v}\| = 5$ and $\|\mathbf{w}\| = 8,$ find the largest possible value of
\[\|\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v}\|.\]
natural solution: &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|}. \end{align}Let $\theta$ be the angle between $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}.$  Then $\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w} = \|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta,$ so

\[\frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \frac{|\|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \|\mathbf{v}\| |\cos \theta| = 5 |\cos \theta| \le 5.\]Equality occurs when $\theta = 0,$ or when $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ point in the same direction, so the largest possible value is $\boxed{5}.$
If $\mathbf{p}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ then the length of $\mathbf{p}$ is the leg of a right triangle that has the length of $\mathbf{v}$ as the hypotenuse.

Thus, geometrically, $\|\mathbf{p}\| \le \|\mathbf{v}\| = 5.$ [asy] unitsize(1 cm); pair O, P, V, W; O = (0,0); V = (10/7,sqrt(3^2 - (10/7)^2)); P = (10/7,0); W = (7,0); draw(O--V,Arrow(6)); draw(O--W,Arrow(6));
draw(O--P,red,Arrow(6)); draw(P--V,dashed); label("$\mathbf{v}$", V, N); label("$\mathbf{w}$", W, E); label("$\mathbf{p}$", P, S); [/asy]

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes v w :: "'a::real_normed_vector"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
shows  "norm (proj w v) \<le> 5"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Given $\|\mathbf{v}\| = 5$ and $\|\mathbf{w}\| = 8,$ find the largest possible value of
\[\|\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v}\|.\] The final Answer is 5
 ### Proof
 Note that \begin{align} \operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v} &= \left\| \frac{\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \mathbf{w} \right\| \\ &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \cdot \|\mathbf{w}\| \\
 &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|}. \end{align}Let $\theta$ be the angle between $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}.$  Then $\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w} = \|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta,$ so
 \[\frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \frac{|\|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \|\mathbf{v}\| |\cos \theta| = 5 |\cos \theta| \le 5.\]Equality occurs when $\theta = 0,$ or when $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ point in the same direction, so the largest possible value is $\boxed{5}.$
 If $\mathbf{p}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ then the length of $\mathbf{p}$ is the leg of a right triangle that has the length of $\mathbf{v}$ as the hypotenuse.
 Thus, geometrically, $\|\mathbf{p}\| \le \|\mathbf{v}\| = 5.$ [asy] unitsize(1 cm); pair O, P, V, W; O = (0,0); V = (10/7,sqrt(3^2 - (10/7)^2)); P = (10/7,0); W = (7,0); draw(O--V,Arrow(6)); draw(O--W,Arrow(6));
 draw(O--P,red,Arrow(6)); draw(P--V,dashed); label("$\mathbf{v}$", V, N); label("$\mathbf{w}$", W, E); label("$\mathbf{p}$", P, S); [/asy]
 *)

theorem
fixes v w :: "'a::real_normed_vector"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
shows  "norm (proj w v) \<le> 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: "Given that the magnitudes of vectors v and w are 5 and 8 respectively, prove that the magnitude of the projection of vector v onto vector w is less than or equal to 5."

theorem
fixes v w :: "real^('n::finite)"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
shows  "norm ((inner v w / (inner w w)) *\<^sub>R w) \<le> 5"

theorem
fixes v w :: "real^('n::finite)"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
shows  "norm ((v \<bullet> w / (norm w)\<^sup>2) *\<^sub>R w) \<le> 5"

a_3.informal problem: Given two vectors, $v$ and $w$, in n-dimensional space where the magnitude of $v$ is 5 and the magnitude of $w$ is 8. Find the magnitude of the projection of $v$ onto $w$. The maximum possible magnitude is 5.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes v w :: "real ^ 'n" and proj :: "real ^ 'n => real ^ 'n => real ^ 'n"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> v w. proj v w = (v \<bullet> w / (norm w)\<^sup>2) *\<^sub>R w"
shows  "norm (proj v w) \<le> 5"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Given $\|\mathbf{v}\| = 5$ and $\|\mathbf{w}\| = 8,$ find the largest possible value of
\[\|\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v}\|.\] The final Answer is 5
 ### Proof
 Note that \begin{align} \operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v} &= \left\| \frac{\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \mathbf{w} \right\| \\ &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \cdot \|\mathbf{w}\| \\
 &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|}. \end{align}Let $\theta$ be the angle between $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}.$  Then $\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w} = \|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta,$ so
 \[\frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \frac{|\|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \|\mathbf{v}\| |\cos \theta| = 5 |\cos \theta| \le 5.\]Equality occurs when $\theta = 0,$ or when $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ point in the same direction, so the largest possible value is $\boxed{5}.$
 If $\mathbf{p}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ then the length of $\mathbf{p}$ is the leg of a right triangle that has the length of $\mathbf{v}$ as the hypotenuse.
 Thus, geometrically, $\|\mathbf{p}\| \le \|\mathbf{v}\| = 5.$ [asy] unitsize(1 cm); pair O, P, V, W; O = (0,0); V = (10/7,sqrt(3^2 - (10/7)^2)); P = (10/7,0); W = (7,0); draw(O--V,Arrow(6)); draw(O--W,Arrow(6));
 draw(O--P,red,Arrow(6)); draw(P--V,dashed); label("$\mathbf{v}$", V, N); label("$\mathbf{w}$", W, E); label("$\mathbf{p}$", P, S); [/asy]
 *)

theorem
fixes v w :: "real ^ 'n" and proj :: "real ^ 'n => real ^ 'n => real ^ 'n"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> v w. proj v w = (v \<bullet> w / (norm w)\<^sup>2) *\<^sub>R w"
shows  "norm (proj v w) \<le> 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given two vectors $v$ and $w$ in an $n$-dimensional space with the norms of $v$ and $w$ being 5 and 8 respectively. Let $proj$ be a function that projects vector $v$ onto vector $w$ defined as $proj(v, w) = \frac{v \cdot w}{||w||^2} \cdot w$. Find the maximum possible value of the norm of the projection of $v$ onto $w$. The final answer is 5.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes v w :: "'a::real_normed_vector"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
shows  "norm (proj w v) <= 5"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Given $\|\mathbf{v}\| = 5$ and $\|\mathbf{w}\| = 8,$ find the largest possible value of
\[\|\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v}\|.\] The final Answer is 5
 ### Proof
 Note that \begin{align} \operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v} &= \left\| \frac{\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \mathbf{w} \right\| \\ &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \cdot \|\mathbf{w}\| \\
 &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|}. \end{align}Let $\theta$ be the angle between $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}.$  Then $\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w} = \|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta,$ so
 \[\frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \frac{|\|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \|\mathbf{v}\| |\cos \theta| = 5 |\cos \theta| \le 5.\]Equality occurs when $\theta = 0,$ or when $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ point in the same direction, so the largest possible value is $\boxed{5}.$
 If $\mathbf{p}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ then the length of $\mathbf{p}$ is the leg of a right triangle that has the length of $\mathbf{v}$ as the hypotenuse.
 Thus, geometrically, $\|\mathbf{p}\| \le \|\mathbf{v}\| = 5.$ [asy] unitsize(1 cm); pair O, P, V, W; O = (0,0); V = (10/7,sqrt(3^2 - (10/7)^2)); P = (10/7,0); W = (7,0); draw(O--V,Arrow(6)); draw(O--W,Arrow(6));
 draw(O--P,red,Arrow(6)); draw(P--V,dashed); label("$\mathbf{v}$", V, N); label("$\mathbf{w}$", W, E); label("$\mathbf{p}$", P, S); [/asy]
 *)

theorem
fixes v w :: "'a::real_normed_vector"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
shows  "norm (proj w v) <= 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Given two vectors v and w in a real normed vector space, where the norm of v is 5 and the norm of w is 8, show that the norm of the projection of w onto v is less than or equal to 5.

fixes v w :: "'a::real_inner"

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes v w :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and norm :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"

and h2 : "\<forall> v w. \<exists> proj. proj w v = (v \<bullet> w / w \<bullet> w) *\<^sub>R w"

 Note that \begin{align} \operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v} &= \left\| \frac{\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \mathbf{w} \right\| \\ &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|^2} \cdot \|\mathbf{w}\| \\
 &= \frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|}. \end{align}Let $\theta$ be the angle between $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}.$  Then $\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w} = \|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta,$ so
 \[\frac{|\mathbf{v} \cdot \mathbf{w}|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \frac{|\|\mathbf{v}\| \|\mathbf{w}\| \cos \theta|}{\|\mathbf{w}\|} = \|\mathbf{v}\| |\cos \theta| = 5 |\cos \theta| \le 5.\]Equality occurs when $\theta = 0,$ or when $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ point in the same direction, so the largest possible value is $\boxed{5}.$
 If $\mathbf{p}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ then the length of $\mathbf{p}$ is the leg of a right triangle that has the length of $\mathbf{v}$ as the hypotenuse.
 Thus, geometrically, $\|\mathbf{p}\| \le \|\mathbf{v}\| = 5.$ [asy] unitsize(1 cm); pair O, P, V, W; O = (0,0); V = (10/7,sqrt(3^2 - (10/7)^2)); P = (10/7,0); W = (7,0); draw(O--V,Arrow(6)); draw(O--W,Arrow(6));
 draw(O--P,red,Arrow(6)); draw(P--V,dashed); label("$\mathbf{v}$", V, N); label("$\mathbf{w}$", W, E); label("$\mathbf{p}$", P, S); [/asy]
 *)

theorem
fixes v w :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and norm :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "norm v = 5"
and h1 : "norm w = 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> v w. \<exists> proj. proj w v = (v \<bullet> w / w \<bullet> w) *\<^sub>R w"
shows  "norm (proj w v) \<le> 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Given two vectors $v$ and $w$ with norms 5 and 8 respectively, find the projection of vector $v$ onto vector $w$. Can you confirm that the norm of this projection is less than or equal to 5?
